subject: Leadership
title: What Makes a Team
description: A micro-lesson that makes What Makes a Team usable.

hook.text: Five people sit at the same table every day but never collaborate. Are they a team or just a group?

buildup.text: A team shares a common goal, mutual accountability, and interdependent tasks. Groups share space but not purpose.

discovery.text: Katzenbach defines a team by shared commitment to outcomes. Without that, you just have individuals nearby.

twist.text: Most 'teams' in organizations are actually workgroups. Recognizing the difference is step one toward real teamwork.

climax.text: True teams outperform groups because members depend on each other. That interdependence is both risk and power.

punchline.text: Teams share goals and fates. Groups just share calendars.

quiz.question: What distinguishes a team from a workgroup?
